alert.note: Alert for Burney Basin, Eastern Shasta County; Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 02 at 2:00AM PST until March 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 5 feet above 2500 feet, and 2 to 14 inches down to 1000 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Burney Basin / Eastern Shasta County, Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley, Motherlode, Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada including Interstate 80 over Donner Pass. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be dangerous to impossible with extended road closures possible. Blowing snow will cause white-out conditions at times. Downed trees and tree limbs with power outages are possible due to heavy snow and strong winds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels 1000 to 2000 feet. Heaviest snow Saturday afternoon through Sunday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Burney Basin, Eastern Shasta County; Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
